intro: Epaltes scabra, commonly known as the rough epaltes, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and broad, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Epaltes scabra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with moderate sunlight.
